data.title: Automotive
data.meta_description: MBE Enterprise-Level Tool, Ready to Take Your Products from the Initial Concept All the Way to Final Release
data.text:
GT-POWER is a powerful engine performance simulation tool that can assist in the development of internal combustion engines. With this tool, you can effectively build an engine from scratch, considering various components and their interactions. With GT-POWER you can,

• Evaluate Performance

• Develop Controls

• Predict Emissions

• Evaluate System Acoustic Characteristics

• Study In-Cylinder Chemical Kinetics

• Perform Finite Element Thermal Analysis and more

GT-POWER

Models built in GT-SUITE enable rapid definition and calibration of cabins, allowing various design studies. GT-TAITherm assists in creating real-time capable 3D cabin comfort models which can be used as standalone or directly implemented to GT-SUITE thermal model. Key application highlights of our cabin comfort simulation solution are,

• Easy to use cabin models of varying resolutions

• Pre-defined geometries

• Real-time capable, 3D high resolution cabin models

• Integration with 3D CFD Tools (GT-CONVERGE, Fluent, STAR, OpenFoam, and other codes)

• Seamlessly integration with subsystems

Cabin Comfort

Gamma Technology shares your passion of making a change for a cleaner, greener and more powerful future by bringing to you GT-FEMAG a legacy product which has been developed over 40 years by the world's leading experts of electric machines backed by GT's centre of excellence. With GT-FEMAG an engineer can perform,

• Topology Selection

• Electromagnetic Design

• Transient Response

• Thermal Security

• Inverter Integration

• Noise Vibration and Harshness

• System Performance

GT-FEMAG

In response to the growing importance of electrification in the global energy landscape, there is a need for advanced simulation tools to develop and optimize electric batteries. GT-AUTOLION is the industry-leading lithium-ion battery simulation software used by cell designers and OEMs. Using battery solution engineer can evaluate,

• Performance

• Degradation

• Safety

• Process Integration

GT-AutoLion

GT-xCHEM includes a complete chemical kinetics and aftertreatment (AT) device library that enables the user to model any AT device in isolation or within an integrated system, while providing the user the complete flexibility to modify and impose the participating kinetic mechanisms.

• Predictive tailpipe emissions with or without integrating with engine, vehicle, controls, etc.

• Design aftertreatment system components (catalyst sizing, washcoat loading, topologies, etc.)

• Can be used for control system development for fuel dosing, urea injection, warmup strategies

• Ideal for drive cycle simulations, real driving emissions (RDE), and real world emissions (route)

• Highly flexible and intuitive user interface for reaction mechanism development

• State-of-the-art mechanisms and validation results for many catalysts and particulate filters

• Fast quasi-2D/3D modeling capability developed from the successful 1D solution

GT-xCHEM

GT-SUITE libraries provide a wide range of options for engineers to customize and design controls, mechanical, and hydraulic components for vehicle models. Engineers can create an advanced vehicle model that includes various subsystems and can assess how they interact with each other at later stages of development or validation. Tailoring vehicle model according to specific requirements or testing scenarios is a key highlight. Using GT-SUITE 3D vehicle mechanics solutions engineers can perform,

• Formal Multibody Dynamics (MBD) mechanical solution methodology, with a fully predictive 3D vehicle solution

• Integration of 1D to 3D mechanics to understand coupled phenomena (NVH, Shift Quality, Driveability) via access to multiple libraries

• Detailed model-based solution for different subsystems (brakes, suspension, powertrain mounts, driver controls, powertrain subsystems)

• Model ANY type of suspension: A-Arm, H-Arm, McPherson

• Integrate ANY type of powertrain architecture: AWD, FWD, RWD, HEV, EV including any transmission architecture AT, MT, AMT, DCT, CVT, IVT, and new, innovative concepts with chassis and suspension
